title: Authors and Citation
text: Jarek Bryk. Author, maintainer. Lewis Ward. Author. Richard Bingham. Author. Wayne-hon Lau. Contributor. Shamus Burns. Contributor.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Bryk J, Ward L, Bingham R (2025). maudr: Generation enzyme kinetics datasets. R package version 0.4.0.
code: @Manual{,   title = {maudr: Generation of enzyme kinetics datasets},   author = {Jarek Bryk and Lewis Ward and Richard Bingham},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.4.0}, }

title: Generation of enzyme kinetics datasets
text: maudr R package designed simulate, distribute, evaluate enzyme kinetics data teaching assessment biochemistry related laboratory courses. allows instructors automatically generate individualized, realistic experimental datasets student (complete enzyme inhibition conditions) produce corresponding answers visual summaries. name package play name Dr Maud Menten, Canadian biochemist established fundamental principles enzyme kinetics, along Dr Leonor Michaelis.

title: Generation of enzyme kinetics datasets
text: maudr available GitHub, plans upload CRAN.

title: Generation of enzyme kinetics datasets
text: package uses enzyme kinetic parameters S. cerevisiae alcohol dehydrogenase, established 1987 publication Ganzhorn et al.. Excel file parameters ADH inhibitors provided default (reaction_parameters.xlsx), however, parameters enzymes inhibitors can provided user, long column names remain unchanged: rxn_substrate Kcat Km Vmax enzyme_conc inhibition_actual default parameters used, input file required package Excel file list students datasets generated analysed. file must one row per student, following column headers: student_no – unique student ID (e.g. “u123456”) first_name – student’s first name surname – student’s surname

title: Generation of enzyme kinetics datasets
text: package four main functions produce students’ datasets analysis results; functions used order.

title: Generation of enzyme kinetics datasets
text: Sets top-level folder (default location: current folder) input data stored output produced. top-level folder named “maudr_assignments” unless different name specified user. Folders data output created, subfolders output/assignments_output output/answers_output. RStudio project structure used.

title: Generation of enzyme kinetics datasets
text: Takes list students table enzyme parameters creates metadata table assignment every student--reaction conditions, randomly drawn reaction_parameters.xlsx file. table deposited output/assignments_output folder top-level project folder created initialiseProject(). neither input files provided, function runs demo mode, using provided list four imaginary students enzyme parameters ADH proceed. output assignReactions() list timestamp metadata table student-reaction assignments. timestamp used input next function serves unique identifier run package.

title: Generation of enzyme kinetics datasets
text: Takes timestamp input (, invisibly, student-reaction assignments table) produces Excel file student absorbances reactions assigned substrate inhibitor. files deposited output/assignments_output folder given timestamp.

title: Generation of enzyme kinetics datasets
text: Takes timestamp input (, invisibly, student-specific files) produces PDF file results analysis students’ data. results include plots : absorbance vs time (inhibited non-inhibited reactions) Michaelis-Menten curves (inhibited non-inhibited reactions) Lineweaver-Burk (inhibited non-inhibited reactions, regression equations) PDF files can generated individually student separate files, together single file, . PDF files deposited output/assignments_output folder given timestamp.

title: Generation of enzyme kinetics datasets
code: library(maudr) initialiseProject(path = "~/Desktop") setup <- assignReactions(student_file = "~/Documents/students_file.xlsx", project_path = "~/Desktop") # students_file.xlsx is copied into the data folder in the top level folder # str(setup) # to check the list created by the assignReaction() function generateAssignments(run_timestamp = setup$timestamp, project_path = "~/Desktop") # Assignments (one Excel file per student) will be deposited in the output/assignment_output folder generateAnswers(run_timestamp = setup$timestamp, project_path = "~/Desktop", output_files = "both") # Assignments (one PDF file per student plus a single PDf with answers from all students' datasets) will be deposited in the output/answers_output folder

title: Summary
text: comes enzyme kinetics, many students can struggle grasp mathematical models concepts behind . [@Silverstein2016; @AlOdat2024; @NelsonCox2021] compounded upon COVID-19 pandemic depriving students laboratory practicals. [@Stenson2022] maudr R package designed generate, simulate visualise enzyme kinetics data within educational context. Educators able create realistic, unique datasets range inhibition types, verify student answers model answers.

title: Summary
text: Although many enzyme kinetics tools exist, majority designed research rather teaching. can complex, require programming skills, locked behind paywall. [@Aledo2022; @MakDunn2024; @Johnson2009; @LiorZ2022] maudr provides lightweight, easy--use interface one single wrapper function. focuses pedagogical clarity educators learners, enables generation datasets visualisations; supporting conceptual learning undergraduate biochemistry molecular biology courses.

title: Summary
text: maudr includes following features: Modular pipeline functions [@PengFunctions; @WickhamPackages; @WickhamBestPractices; @TaylorForecastML]. User-modifiable parameters, well built-defaults. Simulation Michaelis-Menten kinetic models generate student data. Visualisation absorbance-time, Lineweaver-Burk Michaelis-Menten plots. Exporting results figures .pdf files, formatted using user-determined arguments, utilisation teaching materials. Usage examples tutorials included package’s documentation.

title: Summary
text: maudr tested systems running Windows 11 macOS, intended integrated undergraduate biochemistry courses generate enzyme kinetics datasets large-scale classes.

title: Summary
text: project originated need provide interactive, open-source alternative proprietary simulation software teaching labs.

title: Summary
text: Thank Wayne-hon Lau, Dr. Shamus Burns, Dr. Richard Bingham, work early development maudr.

what: Assign reaction conditions to students — assignReactions
title: Assign reaction conditions to students — assignReactions
text: Randomly assigns student one substrate one inhibition type (excluding "no_inhibition"), creates paired condition "no_inhibition". student therefore two rows: one inhibited one uninhibited reaction. function writes metadata Excel file timestamped assignments_output folder.

title: Assign reaction conditions to students — assignReactions
code: assignReactions(   student_file = NULL,   enzyme_file = NULL,   project_path = ".",   seed = 1234,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Assign reaction conditions to students — assignReactions
text: student_file Optional path Excel file containing student list columns student_no, first_name, surname. enzyme_file Optional path Excel file containing enzyme parameters (e.g. reaction_parameters.xlsx). project_path Path top-level project folder created initialiseProject(). Default current working directory. seed Random seed reproducibility (default = 1234). verbose Logical; TRUE (default), prints progress messages.

title: Assign reaction conditions to students — assignReactions
text: Invisibly returns list : timestamp Timestamp string identifying output folder. metadata tibble student–reaction assignments.

title: Assign reaction conditions to students — assignReactions
text: input files provided, demo datasets bundled package used automatically.

title: Assign reaction conditions to students — assignReactions
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ proj <- initialiseProject() assignReactions(project_path = proj, seed = 4321) } # }

what: Generate answer PDFs from assignment Excel files — generateAnswers
title: Generate answer PDFs from assignment Excel files — generateAnswers
text: Reads student assignment files, estimates rates (optionally) Km/Vmax, renders per-student answer pages : Absorbance vs time (faceted rxn_condition) Michaelis-Menten (conditions one plot; optional nls fit) Lineweaver-Burke (conditions one plot; fitted lm lines)

title: Generate answer PDFs from assignment Excel files — generateAnswers
code: generateAnswers(   run_timestamp,   output_files = c("single", "separate", "both"),   project_path = ".",   verbose = TRUE )

title: Generate answer PDFs from assignment Excel files — generateAnswers
text: run_timestamp Timestamp string (YYYY-MM-DD_HHMM) assignReactions(). output_files One "separate", "single", "". Default "single". project_path Path top-level project folder (default "."). verbose Logical; show progress messages (default TRUE).

title: Generate answer PDFs from assignment Excel files — generateAnswers
text: Invisibly TRUE.

what: Generate assignment Excel files for each student — generateAssignments
title: Generate assignment Excel files for each student — generateAssignments
text: Reads setup metadata (assignReactions()) produces per-student Excel files simulated absorbance vs. time data. student receives inhibited uninhibited conditions one sheet. true inhibition type remains instructor metadata.

title: Generate assignment Excel files for each student — generateAssignments
code: generateAssignments(   run_timestamp,   project_path = ".",   verbose = TRUE,   cuv_vol = 0.003,   eps = 6220,   enz_vol = 0.1,   substr_conc = c(0, 10, 20, 40, 80, 160),   time_vec = c(0.17, 0.33, 0.5, 0.66, 0.83, 1),   use_jitter = TRUE,   jitter_sd = 0.02 )

title: Generate assignment Excel files for each student — generateAssignments
text: run_timestamp Timestamp string (YYYY-MM-DD_HHMM) assignReactions(). project_path Path top-level project folder (default "."). verbose Logical; show progress messages (default TRUE). cuv_vol Cuvette volume litres (default 0.003). eps Extinction coefficient (default 6220). enz_vol Enzyme volume millilitres (default 0.1). substr_conc Vector substrate concentrations mM. time_vec Vector reaction time points minutes. use_jitter Logical; add random noise absorbances (default TRUE). jitter_sd Numeric; SD multiplicative noise use_jitter = TRUE (default 0.02, .e. ±2% variability).

title: Generate assignment Excel files for each student — generateAssignments
text: Invisibly returns TRUE writing student assignment files updating metadata.

title: Generate assignment Excel files for each student — generateAssignments
text: Random measurement noise ("jitter") optionally applied per student reproducible way based run seed student ID.

what: Initialise a maudr project folder structure — initialiseProject
title: Initialise a maudr project folder structure — initialiseProject
text: Creates self-contained top-level project folder (default: "maudr_assignments") containing subfolders data/, code/, output/ (assignments_output/ answers_output/ inside). Works RStudio Positron; .Rproj file created.

title: Initialise a maudr project folder structure — initialiseProject
Initialise a maudr project folder structure — initialiseProject
text: path Base directory create project folder (default "."). name Name top-level project folder (default "maudr_assignments"). verbose Logical; show progress messages (default TRUE).

title: Initialise a maudr project folder structure — initialiseProject
text: full path newly created project folder (invisibly).

title: Initialise a maudr project folder structure — initialiseProject
